byline.contributor: Najim Rahim reported from Kunduz, Afghanistan, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul.
byline.original: By NAJIM RAHIM and MUJIB MASHAL

abstract: Officials in Afghanistan report at least 29 people killed and 19 others wounded by suicide bombing aimed at government forces in Kunduz Province; attack underscores ramped up violence by Taliban after confirmation that group's longtime leader Mullah Muhammad Omar is dead.
lead_paragraph: At least 29 people were killed and 19 others wounded in the bombing in the northern Afghan province of Kunduz, Afghan officials said Sunday.

headline.main: 29 Are Killed in Afghanistan as Bombing Targets Militia
headline.print_headline: 29 Are Killed in Afghanistan as Bombing Targets Militia

snippet: At least 29 people were killed and 19 others wounded in the bombing in the northern Afghan province of Kunduz, Afghan officials said Sunday.
